name: Plant Biochemistry
description: This course covers the biochemistry of plants with an emphasis on the reactions of primary and secondary metabolism and the subcellular compartments within plant cells where they occur. The biosynthesis of carbohydrates, amino acids, and lipids will be followed by that of terpenes, alkaloids, phenylpropanoids, glucosinolates, and other natural products with relevance to medicine, nutrition, plant defense, and biotechnology. [36L]
